messages.title: The choice here in Gedling is clear...
messages.content: between someone who has served Gedling for 22 years, helping thousands of residents or a Tory who has worked and lived in London for many years, and who, just last year, stood for election in Tower Hamlets in London.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: I will always stand up for the NHS
I will always stand up for education, including apprenticeships
I will always stand up for pensions, ensure more police on our streets, more training and opportunities for young people

mentions.tacticalSituation: A vote for any other candidate could mean that Gedling has to suffer a Tory MP who supports Tory austerity, a hard Brexit and selling off our NHS.

issues.brexitEurope: You can't trust Boris Johnson. Remember when he said he would "rather be dead in a ditch" than sign the EU for an extension to Brexit negotiations - something he then did.
issues.education: I will always stand up for the NHS, education (includes apprenticeships), pensions, ensure more police on our streets, more training and opportunities for young people
issues.government: You don't need your polling card to vote
issues.health: I will always stand up for the NHS
issues.lawCrime: ensure more police on our streets

community.content: Gedling Labour has managed to keep all local services in house despite the draconian Conservative cuts to the council's budgets. Investment in our leisure centres have included a £ refurbishment to Redhill Leisure Centre and new improvements to Carlton Forum.

leaflet.personalStatement: Vernon has served Gedling as Member of Parliament for 22 years. He has lived in Nottinghamshire since 1975 and did some of his teacher training at what is now Carlton-le-Willows Academy and went to teach at Arnold Hill and Bigwood (now Oakwood) schools, both in Gedling.

examples: Vernon has served Gedling as Member of Parliament for 22 years.
Polling stations, 12 December open 7am - 10pm on Thursday
The parks are now a firm favourite with residents.
You can't trust Boris Johnson
A vote for any other candidate could mean that Gedling has to suffer a Tory MP who supports Tory austerity, a hard Brexit and selling off our NHS.
I will always stand up for the NHS
Gedling Country Park
Bonington Theatre
Leisure Services in Gedling
Local Tories abandon sites in Gedling
Tory fiasco of school places in Gedling
You can't trust Boris Johnson.
Tories inflict highest ever hike in care charges on the most vulnerable in Gedling.
A Tory MP who supports Tory austerity
